title: What would it take for the Patriots to land AJ Brown? ESPN analyst cooked up a hypothetical trade.
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots may trade for Eagles' AJ Brown to improve their wide receiver position this offseason.
Proposed trade: Patriots give up 2026 first, third, and sixth-round picks for AJ Brown and a 2026 second-round pick.
AJ Brown, 28, signed a 3-year, $96 million extension and has consistently achieved strong performance metrics.

title: Why Kyle Pitts could be the Patriots’ top free-agent target
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The New England Patriots are considering Kyle Pitts as a top free-agent target to enhance their offense.
Kyle Pitts had an impactful 2025 season with the Atlanta Falcons, recording 88 catches for 928 yards and five touchdowns.
Pitts could be a more affordable option for the Patriots with a projected four-year, $70 million contract and $17.5 million cap hit.

title: Provincetown man pleads guilty to possessing, distributing thousands of child porn files
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Laurence Pagnoni, 65, from Provincetown pleaded guilty to possession and distribution of child pornography in federal court.
Pagnoni distributed thousands of child porn files via MEGA and was arrested in April 2024 after a tip from a sting operation.
Pagnoni's sentencing is set for May 12, facing up to 20 years per charge and a $250,000 fine.

title: Former Patriots QB Brian Hoyer shares family tragedy with ‘sudden’ death of sister-in-law
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Brian Hoyer shares the sudden death of his sister-in-law, Carissa Rae Hoyer, at 36 years old.
Hoyer's brother Brett is now a widowed father to four daughters under age 12 after Carissa's passing.
A GoFundMe set by the Hoyer family has raised over $109,000 to support Brett and his daughters.

title: 4 takeaways as Fleet captain Megan Keller lifts Team USA to gold medal triumph over Canada
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Megan Keller scored the overtime winner as Team USA defeated Canada 2-1 for the Olympic gold in women's hockey.
Aerin Frankel made 30 saves, helping Team USA secure an undefeated 7-0 record at the 2026 Winter Olympics in Milan.
Hilary Knight tied the game with a late goal and became the all-time leading scorer for U.S. women's Olympic hockey.

title: Man faces felony assault charges after string of random sexual attacks in and around Malden T station
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Ralph Fleuristil, 34, from Melrose, faces charges for sexual assaults in Malden, including two felony counts of indecent assault.
Attacks occurred around Malden Center MBTA stop, involving victims over 14 and a person over 60/disabled, police allege.
Fleuristil is held on $7,500 bail, with conditions including GPS tracking; his next court appearance is March 5.

title: Anti-abortion center’s lawsuit against Mass. officials gets tossed
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A federal judge dismissed Your Options Medical's lawsuit against Massachusetts officials over a public campaign criticizing crisis pregnancy centers.
Judge Sorokin ruled the state's campaign didn't violate constitutional rights, allowing officials to share opinions on pregnancy resource centers.
Your Options Medical plans to appeal, arguing the court overlooked a coordinated state effort against anti-abortion centers.

title: Bruins, Marco Sturm must do their ‘homework’ to fix team’s top flaw for stretch run
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins focus on improving penalty kill as team ranks 28th in the NHL with a 76.4% PK rate.
Boston is in the second wild-card spot in the Eastern Conference with a 32-20-5 record.
Coach Marco Sturm aims to reduce penalties and enhance team performance during remaining 25-game schedule.

title: This Boston Marathon bombing survivor is running with Miles for Miracles
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Juliana Hermenegildo, 36, from Rehoboth, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon with the Miles for Miracles team.
She aims to raise funds for Boston Children's Hospital, inspired by her son's heart surgery in November 2024.
Hermenegildo seeks personal healing from PTSD caused by the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing near the finish line.

title: Teaming up with Al Horford against Celtics will be ‘weird,’ Kristaps Porzingis says
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Kristaps Porzingis and Al Horford will face the Celtics as part of the Golden State Warriors on Thursday.
Porzingis speaks of the 'weird' experience facing his former team after spending two seasons with the Celtics.
Al Horford appreciates maintaining his Celtics relationships, despite moving to the Warriors' West Coast team.
